As part of my homework and research, I investigated how to alter the resource abundance for a planet/biome/global setting without requiring me to create a new save. Below are my test results:

Ore abundance before the test:

![YkRtP2o.png](http://i.imgur.com/YkRtP2o.png)

Ore abundance after the test:

![l8dK12D.png](http://i.imgur.com/l8dK12D.png)

Bottom line is I can alter the resource abundance without requiring you to reload the game or create a new save. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) What does that mean?

It means I'll have that Gold Digger Portable Mini-Drill available as the first part in Pathfinder very soon. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Sombrero - keeps the sun off your head to make electricity.
Actually, I think Sombrero works. Makes me think of the circular solar panels from NASA. Nice new name. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Angel - Just a request, but I'm hoping that you don't go too far with the dangit type of faults and failures that come up. I think Dangit is an awesome program, but I don't use it in all my games. In the same way, I don't use interplanetary launch pads (though I'm thinking of getting into it). I'd love there to be a version or option for Pathfinder that just lets you deploy with KAS and KIS and then stays relatively stable. Call it a dumb-dumb version?

Also, a mild suggestion, color coding of the structures could be helpful. It'd be a quick way of knowing which structure you're looking at from the outside in case you get turned around doing an EVA.

I like the PONDEROSA lettering on the side, but I'm gonna be building these a lot of different places. As a down-the-road idea, it'd be cool to be able to label them differently.

Anyways, just throwing ideas out there. Can't wait to play this, it looks super-good!
Can't wait to test this out. Would any of these structures have mining capabilities for Ore/Karbonite and such?

Not to worry, the "Your Game, Your Choice" aspect of my mods means, in this case, that using Dangit is optional. You'll have a way to opt into Dangit support- or not as you see fit. 

Color coding is definitely doable, and lit color coded panels in the dark would be even more helpful. Definitely will add that to the list. 

As for labeling, the Ponderosa name is part of the branding, but the model has decal panels already built in. Templates change the panel decals in flight/VAB/SPH as well as add/remove functionality. By creating custom templates you could easily change those decals to your liking. To give you an idea of how this works, download the latest DSEV and play with the FLM series of tanks. the only difference between the tanks and the Ponderosa is that the Ponderosa decals must be square, but they can glow in the dark. Sadly I cannot make non-square decals that also glow in the dark due to a KSP limitation. At least as far as I know...

Thank you for your suggestions. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> Can't wait to test this out. Would any of these structures have mining capabilities for Ore/Karbonite and such?

The Chuckwagon and Conestoga can be configured to hold a variety of different resources including Ore, and a skilled Engineer will be able to reconfigure the Gold Digger to drill for any resource in the biome/asteroid. I might retrofit the Drill-O-Matic with the same ability. In Career mode you will need to unlock the proper tech node first to use the Gold Digger for resource extraction. Please keep in mind that the portable drill pales in comparison to the much larger Drill-O-Matic. Similarly I could see a mini ISRU that you could use. I could also see them turning themselves off at high timewarps to help play balance them. Conceptually they'd be used in a pinch to slowly refuel your craft before moving on...
